newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: New Zealand dollar ends steady, range-bound.
newsitem.headline: New Zealand dollar ends steady, range-bound.

text.p: The New Zealand dollar closed virtually unchanged on Friday, having traded within a tight US$0.6986-96 range.
"The demise of the Aussie overnight really put a cap on the Kiwi and it never really looked as though we were going to go back above the (0.7000) figure on the day," a dealer said.
"Saying that however, we've seen further Japanese buying, nothing of size, that's the reason we haven't moved, but it certainly helped underpin the Kiwi."
The Kiwi closed at 0.6989/96, the same level at which it opened the session. On its Trade-Weighted Index, the Kiwi closed at 66.77, slightly above its 66.74 open.
Dealers said there was local buying interest in the Kiwi in the mid-0.6980 area.
"The outlook is pretty mixed," said one dealer. "If anything, the topside is going to be relatively well capped up towards the 0.7010 level, particularly with the way the Aussie came off."
He said the Australian unit had reached 0.7965 mid-week, but was closing at around 0.7905/10 on Friday.
The risks for the Kiwi now lay more on the downside, dealers said.
"I think if anything the risks are that we could see the 0.6980 level break and maybe head down towards 0.6960," the dealer said.
"But to be honest it's in a tight range and it really doesn't look as though it's ging to break out of it right now."
Dealers saw the Kiwi trading a 0.6980-0.7000 range overnight. -- Matthew Brockett 64 4 4714 272
